description: Wood mask with carving in relief and stained highlights. Mask has symbolic representation of Barack Obama rather than a pictoral likeness. Mask has cowry shell design on forehead, a symbol of fortune-telling; a crown on top, a symbol of leadership; a juju leaf carved on the crown, representing the protection of Obama. Mask accompanied by folder of materials. Mask has round metal hook on back. Artist and Senegambia Market depicted in accompanying materials.
title: Obama mask.

description: Cotton fabric printed with an orange, black, and yellow geometric background design of nested, broken squares. The cloth is further decorated with a regular pattern of the phrase "African Image" in black text with a white background, the Adinkra symbols "Ohene Adwa" and "Gye Nyame" in black, and large white ovals printed with full-color photographic images of Barack Obama, with "Barack Obama, 44th President of the United States" on a ribbon shaped banner below it. The top and bottom borders of the cloth contain the Adinkra symbols "Gye Nyame" and "Ohene Adwa" repeated along it in black with yellow outlines, all on an orange and black background. The maker's mark on the selvage reads "Akosombo Textiles Limited."
title: Barack Obama African Image fabric in orange.

description: Large-scale multicolor banner with portraits of Barack Obama and John Evans Atta-Mills. Banner has portrait of Atta-Mills at left superimposed on flag of Ghana with "President J.E. Atta Mills" in caption below. Portrait of Obama is at right superimposed on stylized flag of United States with "President Barack Obama" in caption below. Center of banner has "Akwaaba" in yellow lettering at top, "Partnership for Change, 10th and 11th July 2009" in blue lettering below. Banner has metal grommets reinforced by folded vinyl at four corners.

description: Blue cloth bag with multicolor printed woven pat and portrait of Barack Obama. Bag has large front cover flap with velcro fastener; large pocket within bag has zipper in black. Cloth has blue background with black, green, and yellow diagonal design. Portrait of Obama is on white background and framed in white, black, and red lines; "Barack Obama, 44th President of the United States" in blue lettering below on small white banner with black outline. Portrait partially repeated with "Akwaaba" (Welcome) in black lettering on white between portraits. Margins have a row of symbols in yellow and black. Strap in same fabric as bag with woven nylon lining. Apron produced by African Image (South Africa) on cloth from Akosombo Textiles Limited (Ghana).
title: Blue cloth bag, full-color image of Obama, green, black, yellow detail.

description: Multicolor painting on rough-hewn plywood panel with white primer. Type of paint not identified. Painting has Barack Obama in blue suit and red and white striped tie gazing and pointing with right arm. Portrait of George W. Bush to left superimposed on green image of continent of Africa with "God bless America and the world" in white lettering. Background of painting is flag of United States in reverse; stars of flag replaced by "Barack Obama" and stylized stars in white. Painting has solid green at bottom. Painting originally displayed at a barber shop.

description: Cloth made to celebrate the 2008 election of President Barack Obama. Rectangular cotton kanga with yellow background. In the center is a black and white oval portrait of Obama with the Swahili words "Hongera Barack Obama" (Congratulations Barack Obama) above and around his head. On the left and right of the portrait are maps of Africa. Below the portrait is the Swahili phrase "Upendo Na Amani Ametujalia Mungu" (Love and peace granted by God). The kanga has a thick border around all four sides printed in black, white, and yellow in repeating geometric motifs (dots, flowers, grids). The maker's mark on the lower selvage reads: "Nida Nzito Khanga Pamba Ya Tanzania Giga:7424.

description: Cloth made to celebrate the 2008 election of President Barack Obama. Rectangular cotton kanga with dark blue background. In the center is a black and white oval portrait of Obama with "Hongera Barack Obama" (Swahili: Congratulations Barack Obama) above portrait. On the left and right of the portrait are maps of Africa with the countries printed in white, green, and red. Below the portrait is the Swahili phrase "Upendo Na Amani Ametujalia Mungu" (Swahili: Love and peace granted by God). The kanga has a thick frame border printed in black, white, and blue in repeating geometric motifs (dots, flowers, grids). The maker's mark on lower selvage reads: "Nida Nzito Khanga Pamba Ya Tanzania Giga:7424.
title: Hongera Barack Obama kanga--blue.

notes.note: In Swahili with names of countries on map in English.
Library owns two single panels and one double panel of this kanga design.

description: Cloth made to celebrate the 2008 election of President Barack Obama. Rectangular cotton kanga in red, white, blue. description: White bumper sticker with multicolor text and image. Left of bumper sticker has portrait of Barack Obama in white dress shirt and grey patterned necktie on blue oval background. Right of bumper sticker has "Obama is Unbwogable!" on three lines in dark blue lettering. The term "unbwogable" is a Sheng street slang term from Nairobi, Kenya, meaning "unshakable." description: Multicolor cotton shirt of Akosombo Textiles Limited "Akwaaba" design. Shirt is of blue cloth with multicolor printed woven pat and repeating portraits of Barack Obama; portrait is placed on a blue background with black, green, and yellow diagonal design. Each portrait of Obama is on white background and framed in white, black, and red lines; "Barack Obama, 44th President of the United States" is in blue lettering below on small white banner with black outline. "Akwaaba" (the Akan language term for "welcome") is in black lettering on white between portraits. The margin of the cloth, which has symbols in yellow and black, is placed at the collar and end of sleeves.

description: Multicolor painting on unfinished plywood panel with white primer and multicolor background. Type of paint not identified; likely in oil. Portrait of Barack Obama at left and Kaka at right kicking a soccer ball. Barack Obama is in black suit with white dress shift collar. Kaká is in Brazil national football team kit wearing the number 10 shirt, likely a reference to the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup or 2010 FIFA World Cup. Portraits are superimposed on stylized flags of South Africa at left and the United States at right. "Barack Hussein Obama" is in black lettering with white line shading at upper right of painting; "Kaka", followed by a comma, is in black lettering to right of soccer player. Signature of artist is in faint black lettering to right of portrait of Barack Obama. Painting is framed with solid black line.
title: Barack Hussein Obama, Kaka.

description: Tote bag with zippered top, made from woven polypropylene fabric. Main body of bag is dark blue and has blue trim sewn around the edges and seams. The sides and top of the bag are printed with the repeated phrase "See the world." The handles are missing from the bag with re large tears where they were once attached. The front and back of the bag are decorated with four photographic images: Barack Obama in front of the Washington DC Capitol building; Obama behind a podium speaking to a crowd, with the caption "Change we can believe in" and his campaign logo, followed by "Iowa.BarackObama.com"; Michelle Obama speaking to another woman; the Obama family on the 2008 election night. A label on the bag reads "Shen long. Guang zho uzhi zao."

description: Kanga cloth made to celebrate the 2008 election of President Barack Obama. Rectangular with dark blue background and red designs. In the center are three overlapping portraits of Obama surrounded by four American flags arranged in a diamond shape. The Obama campaign logo is in each corner of the center panel. Below the portrait is the phrase "Yes We Can." The kanga has a red border with white stars and "2008" repeated in the background. The maker's mark reads: "Somo Moto, Histori-Kali. African Pride Textile Mills Ltd. Lesso. Printed tanzania Khanga Des No. 9116"
title: "Yes we can - Obama" kanga -- blue and red.

description: Kanga cloth made to celebrate the 2008 election of President Barack Obama. Rectangular with black background and red, white, and blue design elements. In the center are three overlapping portraits of Obama surrounded by four American flags arranged in a diamond shape. The Obama campaign logo is in each corner of the center panel. Below the portrait is the phrase "Ndiyo, Tunaweza - Obama" (translation: Yes We Can - Obama). The kanga has a border made of two thin white stripes with stars between them and "2008" in red, white, and blue outlined letters, repeated in the outermost border. The maker's mark reads: "Somo Moto, Histori-Kali. African Pride Textile Mills Ltd. Lesso. Printed tanzania Khanga Des No. 9116"
title: "Ndiyo, Tunaweza - Obama" kanga -- blue and red.

description: Length of cotton cloth with geometric pattern background and repeating portraits of Barack Obama. Background is stylized plant design in light brown, darka, brown and red on repeating diamonds. Cloth has repeating oval portraits of Barack Obama arranged diagonally on three horizontal lines. Portrait of Obama, waving and in a black suit and purple tie, is on white background framed with blue flower-and-leaf motif. Portraits are interspersed with banners reading "44th President of the United States" in black lettering and the flag of the United States. Manufacturer's label ("COMATEX SA") on top and bottom margins of cloth.

description: Patterned length of cloth in red, white, blue, and black. Length of cloth has multicolor geometric pattern and repeating portraits of Barack Obama. Background is chartreuse with repeating horizontal portraits of Barack Obama, one small and one large. Larger portrait of Obama is on red background and framed in black leaf motif with star at top; "Hooray for the President" in stylized banner below portrait. White star superimposed on mouth of President. Smaller portrait of Obama is on red background and framed in black outline with "People of the world this is our moment, this is our time" in pink lettering. Background has repeating pattern of large pink roses with red leaf and brown stem. Pink fist with "Hope" in brown lettering below portrait; black classic car with pink outline, "Shine Shine" in white lettering on side, and white star on front at bottom of cloth border. Cloth is framed at top and bottom in wave printed trim in red and pink semicircular design. Manufacturer's mark at bottom of fabric with dye samples. Pattern: ER-537/5. Pattern is 142 x 189 on fabric 155 x 189 cm.
title: Hooray for the President cloth.

description: Cotton dress with multicolor printed woven pat. Fabric is ivory with green, yellow, red, blue, and black printed woven pat. Fabric has repeating black-and-white oval portraits of Barack Obama, Michelle Obama, Prof. John E.A. Mills and Naadu Mills arranged diagonally in horizontal rows. Each portrait is framed by oval multicolored frames and a caption. A multicolor motif of the American and Ghanian flags with "July - 2009" in throughout pattern; the same motif without text is located between each portrait. Dress has white zipper at back with small metal clasps at top; dress lined in ivory silk.

alternate_title: "Congratulations President Obama. Kenyans wish you success" kanga
description: Cloth made to celebrate the 2008 election of President Barack Obama. Rectangular cotton kanga in red, white, green, black. The central design is alternating red and white stripes with a color photographic image of Obama in front of the US Capitol building superimposed. Below the portrait is the phrase "Hongera Obama sisi wakenya twajivunia" which roughly translates to "Congratulations Obama. All Kenya celebrates with you." The border has the American flag, Kenyan flag, and large red, green, and black stars repating along it. The maker's marks on the lower selvage reads: "Regd. Mali ya mtoto Mombasa Kenya" and "No RR 17005-Rivatex E.A. Eldoret Made in Kenya."
title: "Hongera Obama sisi wakenya twajivunia" kanga.

description: Multicolor painting on unfinished plywood panel with white primer and multicolor background. Type of paint not identified; likely in oil. Portrait of unidentified man is at left, Kendall Fletcher is at center kicking a soccer ball, and Barack Obama is at right. Unidentified man at left has white headband with flag of South Africa, black sunglasses with "Heavy Jay" on left frame, and dark green scarf. Kendall Fletcher is in is in University of North Carolina women's soccer team kit wearing the number 4 shirt. Barack Obama is in black suit, white dress shirt, and red necktie, and pin of United States Flag on right lapel of suit. Portraits are superimposed on stylized flags of South Africa at left and the United States at right. "Barack Hussein Obama" is in black lettering with white line shading at upper right of painting; "Kendall Fletcher" is in black lettering to right of soccer player. Signature of artist is in faint black lettering at lower left. Painting is framed with solid yellow line.
title: Barack Hussein Obama, Kendall Fletcher.

description: Tote bag with two handles and a zippered top, made from woven polypropylene fabric. Main body of bag is dark blue and has red trim sewn around the edges and seams. The phrase "Yes We Can" is printed down the left side of the portrait in white text on a red rectangle.
title: Tote bag with Barack Obama and Yes We Can designs.

description: Rear-view mirror hanging made from a flat, rectangular glass medallion decorated on both sides with a full color photographic portrait of Barack Obama on an American flag background. description: Small paper flag with purple background with multicolor portrait and lettering. Front has portrait of Barack and Michelle Obama with "We are the hopes and dreams of our ancestors" in white lettering above; stripe at bottom has small monochromatic portraits of figures of the African diaspora with "The Diaspora African Forum" at bottom left in white lettering and logo of organization at bottom right. Back has flag of Diaspora Africa Forum organization in purple, grey, and black at top; "Akwaaba Obama from (AU) Diaspora Africa Forum" in white lettering below. Contact information of Diaspora Africa Forum in small lettering at bottom. Flag glued to thin wooden pole.
title: We are the hopes and dreams of our ancestors flag.

description: Blue apron with multicolor printed woven pat and repeating portraits of Barack Obama. Cloth has blue background with black, green, and yellow diagonal design. Each portrait of Obama is on white background and framed in white, black, and red lines; "Barack Obama, 44th President of the United States" in blue lettering below on small white banner with black outline. "Akwaaba" (Welcome) in black lettering on white between portraits. Margins have a row of symbols in yellow and black. Ties in black cotton; small pocket sewn on bottom front of apron. Apron produced by African Image (South Africa) on cloth from Akosombo Textiles Limited (Ghana).
title: Barack Obama, 44th President of the United States apron.

alternate_title: "Congratulations Obama. All Kenya celebrates with you" shirt
description: Short-sleeved pullover shirt made from kanga cloth. Front of shirt: black and white photographic image of Obama in front of the US Capitol building, made from the center panel of a kanga. Below the portrait is the phrase: "Hongera Obama. Sisi Wakenya Twajivunia" which translates to "Congratulations Obama. All Kenya celebrates with you." Body and sleeves are made from the kanga borders, using the portions with American and Kenyan flags and blue and red stars.
title: "Hongera Obama sisi wakenya twajivunia" shirt.

description: Black plastic (or vinyl) flip-flop thong sandals with an inverted-v foot strap. The word "Obama" runs along the footbed in red, outlined in white. description: Ivory kanga with multicolor printed woven pat with large repeating squares. Each square has portraits of Barack Obama and John Mills on yellow oval background; "Obama & Mill" in blue lettering above, "July-2009" in blue lettering on small yellow banner with blue outline below repeated on. Portrait repeated at opposite sides of square separated by a yellow diagonal stripe with black line. Perimeter of square has wide stripe in the pattern of the United States flag and wide stripe of the flag of Ghana, each on opposite sides. The maker's mark reads: "GTP, Ghana, 2406".

description: Multicolor vinyl bag with black lining and zipper at top. description: Plastic makaraba rugby hat with vertical cutouts and adjustable plastic interior straps at interior. Makaraba is made of an Athol brand construction hat, manufactured by Corporate Clothing ZA, painted white with rim painted blue. The makaraba has a large vertcal cut-out at center with portrait of Barack Obama at top and Western Hemisphere of globe at middle. Signature of artist is in grey lettering at base of Obama portrait, "S.MHI 09". Left cut-out is in the shape of a donkey, symbol of the United States Democratic Party; right cut-out is in the shape of the United States flag. Cut-outs have multi-color painting. Center front of Makaraba has "Obama" in blue lettering on stylized red and white banners with a small donkey and elephent in grey above in grey and star below in grey. Makaraba rim and top of cap at cut-out is painted blue. Interior of makaraba has manufacturer's label pasted at left; construction hat manufacturing information is below rim.
title: Obama makaraba pop-up helmet.

description: Multicolor painting on unfinished plywood panel with black primer. Type of paint not identified; likely in oil. Portrait of Barack Obama in brown dress suit at right. Flag of the United States in background with "Barack Obama" in green lettering above portrait, "yes, we can'", "Barack" means "blessed", and "he has gone further than any African-American presidential aspirant in seeking his party's" in green, white, and black lettering at left below stars. Signature of artists and date of painting at lower right in black lettering.
title: Barack Obama : "yes, we can", "Barack" means "blessed".

description: Mint sheet of 4 multicolor postage stamps of Sierra Leone in commemorative sheet. At left: "A new beginning, Barack Obama, President of the United States of America historic commorative postal issue" in gold and dark blue lettering superimposed on presidential seal, image of the White House, and United States flag. At right: four identical multicolor postage stamps with image of Barack Obama on seal of the President of the United States in background; white lettering above and below image on a dark red background. Denomination: "Le 3000". "44th President of the United States of America" at bottom of sheet in gold and white lettering on dark blue background. Printed on white paper with adhesive on verso.
title: A new beginning : Barack Obama, President of the United States of America.

description: Acrylic painting on unstreched muslin canvas, not mounted. A portrait of Barack Obama against a background of a blue and white sky with white clouds. The word "Artists" in white capital san-serif lettering stenciled at bottom. Obama is smiling and wearing a red tunic. Commissioned by graduate student Brooke Bocast during her field research in Uganda.

alternate_title: Zanzibar for Obama fan Yes we can fan
description: Circular hand-held fan with wooden handle. The fan is made from a single strip of braided or woven straw or grass which was then stitched into a flat spiral. The fan is attatched to a wooden stick which can be used as a handle. The fan is painted white and has multicolored decorations. One side of the fan is painted with the words "Yes We Can" in black and is decorated with a large purple and blue flower. The other side is painted with the phrase "Zanzibar for Obama" in black letters and is decorated with a large orange flower. The handle has two thick yellow stripes painted on it.
title: Yes We Can / Zanzibar For Obama woven fan.
physical_description_material: 1 fan : straw or grass, wood, paint

alternate_title: Hongera Barack Obama khanga -- light purple Congratulations Barack Obama kanga -- light purple
description: Rectangular cotton kanga with light purple background. In the center is a black and white oval portrait of Obama with the Swahili words "Hongera Barack Obama" (Congratulations Barack Obama) above and around his head. On the left and right of the portrait are maps of Africa with the countries printed in white, green, and red. Below the portrait is the Swahili phrase "Upendo Na Amani Ametujalia Mungu" (Love and peace granted by God). The kanga has a thick border printed in black, white, and light purple in repeating geometric motifs (dots, flowers, grids). The maker's mark on the lower selvage reads: "Nida Nzito Khanga Pamba Ya Tanzania Giga:7424.
title: Hongera Barack Obama kanga -- light purple.

Reverse of phone has "Obama" in holographic lettering at top and "Yes we can" in white lettering below. Logo of 2008 Barack Obama campaign in white below text. Cellular telephone issued in multicolor box with small gray pouch, earphones, and user guide booklet. Box measures in box 144 x 110 x 35 mm. Model number: Mi-205f. International adapter in blue box accompanies donation.

alternate_title: Hongera Barack Obama khanga -- red Congratulations Barack Obama kanga -- red
description: Cloth made to celebrate the 2008 election of President Barack Obama. Rectangular cotton kanga with red background. In the center is a black and white oval portrait of Obama with the Swahili words "Hongera Barack Obama" (Congratulations Barack Obama) above and around his head. On the left and right of the portrait are maps of Africa with the countries printed in white, green, and blue. Below the portrait is the Swahili phrase "Upendo Na Amani Ametujalia Mungu" (Love and peace granted by God). The kanga has a thick border printed in black, white, and red in repeating geometric motifs (dots, flowers, grids). The maker's mark on the lower selvage reads: "Nida Nzito Khanga Pamba Ya Tanzania Giga:7424.
title: Hongera Barack Obama kanga -- red.

alternate_title: Hongera Barack Obama, Obama Chaguo la Mungu khanga -- orange Congratulations Barack Obama, Obama the will of God kanga -- orange
description: Cloth made to celebrate the 2008 election of President Barack Obama. Rectangular orange cotton kanga. In the center is a black and white oval portrait of Obama with the Swahili words "Hongera Barack Obama" (Congratulations Barack Obama) above and around his head. In each corner of the central design is a red, white, and blue American flag. At the base of the central design is the Swahili phrase "Obama Chaguo La Mungu" (Obama [is] the choice of God). The kanga has a thick border on all sides composed of stripes and stars in orange, black, and white, echoing the motifs in the American flag. The maker's mark on the lower selvage reads: "Khanga Nzito. Mali Ya Tanzania Mama (circle A) Art. 1748.
title: Hongera Barack Obama, Obama Chaguo la Mungu kanga -- orange.

description: Cloth made to celebrate the 2008 election of President Barack Obama. Rectangular cotton kanga in red, white, blue. The central design is a large American flag with a color photographic image of Obama in front of the White House superimposed over it. Below the portrait is the phrase "Heko rais Obama wakenya twakutakia kila la heri" which roughly translates to "Congratulations President Obama! Kenyans wish you success." The border has the American flag, Kenyan flag, and large red and blue stars repating along it. The maker's mark on the lower selvage reads: No RR 17006-Rivatex E.A. Eldoret Made in Kenya.
title: "Heko rais Obama wakenya twakutakia kila la heri" kanga.

description: Kanga cloth made to celebrate the 2008 election of President Barack Obama. Rectangular with black background and red, white, and blue design elements. In the center are three overlapping portraits of Obama surrounded by four American flags arranged in a diamond shape. The Obama campaign logo is in each corner of the center panel. Below the portrait is the phrase "Ndiyo, Tunaweza - Obama" (translation: Yes We Can - Obama). The kanga has a border made of two thin white stripes with stars between them and "2008" in red, white, and blue outlined letters, repeated in the outermost border. The maker's mark reads: "Somo Moto, Histori-Kali. African Pride Textile Mills Ltd. Lesso. Printed Tanzania Khanga Des No. 9114."
title: "Ndiyo, Tunaweza - Obama" kanga -- black.

"Barack Hussein Obama" is in white lettering at upper center of painting; "Mallory Mahar" is in white lettering to right of soccer player. description: Cotton fabric printed with a green, black, and white geometric background design reminiscent of diamonds or pyramids. The cloth is further decorated with a regular pattern of large white ovals printed with full-color photographic images of Barack Obama and Michelle Obama or Barack Obama alone. Each oval has the "Barack Obama" on a ribbon shaped banner below it. The background is also decorated with small white rectangles with the words "Change" and small American flags. The maker's mark on the selvage reads "Batex. Ci fabrique au Mali dessin no. 805"
title: Barack and Michelle Obama fabric in green.

description: Black leather belt with metal buckle. The belt buckle is a metal clamping style and has two lenticular (shifting) full color photographic images of Obama: a close up in front of the presidential seal and Obama standing in front of an American flag and behind a podium displaying the sign "Change we can believe in."

description: Multicolor painting on unfinished plywood panel with white primer and light green background. Type of paint not identified; likely in oil. Portrait of unidentified woman at left, Barack Obama at center, and unidentified man at right. Unidentified woman at left is in a dark blue shirt with single hoop earring. Barack Obama is in a black suit with white dress shirt and white tie. Unidentified man at right is in white shirt with stylized beard and haircut. Portraits are superimposed on electric cord pulled by by a shirtless man, depiected much smaller than portraits, wearing blue jeans. "D.B. Haircut" is in white lettering with blue line tracing at upper center of painting; "Barack Obama " is in black lettering to right of Obama portrait. Signature of artist is in faint black lettering above shoulder of portrait of Barack Obama.
title: D.B. Haircut, Barack Obama.

description: White t-shirt with multicolor silkscreen on front. T-shirt has altered image of Mount Rushmore at center. description: Length of cotton cloth with geometric pattern background and repeating portraits of Barack Obama. Repeating portraits of Obama are on white background and framed in white, black, and red lines; "Barack Obama, 44th President of the United States" is in blue lettering below on small white banner with black outline. "Akwaaba" (the Akan language term for "welcome") is in black lettering on white between portraits. The margin of the cloth has Akan symbols in red and black. The maker's mark on the lower selvage reads: "Akosombo Textiles Limited".
title: Barack Obama, 44th President of the United States "Akwaaba" cloth.

description: Acrylic painting on textured polycotton stretched canvas stapled on stretcher bars; elements of painting outlined in black paint pen. Painting has a portrait of Barack and Michelle Obama wearing Ghanian kente cloth in foreground with couple standing on street in a neighborhood. Barack Obama is in full-length kente cloth over right shoulder, white shirt below, blue and orange large bead bracelet, and wearing Ghanian sandals. Michelle Obama is wearing off-the-shoulder gown made of identical kente cloth with blue panel at top, yellow necklace, and matching bracelet on right hand. Portraits are against background of brown shaded city street with a single house to to left and multiple houses to right. Background has plain sky with three black birds at upper right.  Signature of artist at lower left of painting on three lines.
title: Bachelle.
